scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a single business letter book, maintained by Hileman, Waring and Company, a manufacturer of pig iron at Callie Furnace (Botetourt County), Virginia, during the late 19th century. The volume contains carbon copies of the company's outgoing correspondence. The letters relate to such routine business matters as land transfers, supply orders, accounts payable and receivable. The final letters relate to attempts to sell the furnace property.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical
bioghist.p: Hileman, Waring and Company, manufactuerers of pig iron, operated Callie Furnace in Botetourt County, Virginia, during the late 19th century. The company's letterhead lists the following as officers: J. B. Hileman, O. Hileman, E. J. Waring, and O. T. Waring.
Callie Furnace had been built for D. S. Cook of Wrightsville, Pennsylvania ca. 1873. Hileman, Waring and Company seems to have operated the furnace from about 1881 to 1885.
